meanings.definition: A window or opening in a wall.
meanings.sent1: The sunlight streamed through the winnocks, brightening the room.
meanings.sent2: She peeked through the winnocks to see who was outside.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat squeezed through the winnocks and into the house.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like winnocks into her soul, revealing her true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The winnocks framed a picturesque view of the garden.

meanings.sent1: He used a sieve to winnocks the wheat and remove the chaff.
meanings.sent2: The farmer would winnocks the harvested grains to separate the wheat from the husks.
meanings.sent3: The chef decided to winnocks the flour before baking the bread.
meanings.sent4: She gently winnocks the rice to ensure only the best grains are used.
meanings.sent5: The wind would naturally winnocks the seeds, separating them from the debris.

meanings.sent1: She found a winnocks of glass from the shattered vase.
meanings.sent2: The child collected colorful winnocks of shells along the shore.
meanings.sent3: The artist used tiny winnocks of paper to create a beautiful collage.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like scattered winnocks of a broken mirror, reflecting fragments of the past.
meanings.sent5: The winnocks of the mosaic added a touch of elegance to the floor.
